title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 41.1 - Shellfish lands in Westchester, Rockland, Bronx, Kings, New York, Richmond, and Queens Counties
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 41.1 - Shellfish lands in Westchester, Rockland, Bronx, Kings, New York, Richmond, and Queens Counties

State Regulations
(a) During the
period January 1 through December 31, both dates inclusive, all shellfish lands
in Westchester, Rockland, Bronx, Kings, New York, Richmond, and Queens

Counties, except those lands listed in subdivision (b) of this section, are in
such sanitary condition that the shellfish thereon shall not be taken for use
as food, and such lands are designated as uncertified areas. (b) Atlantic Ocean. During the
period January 1 through December 31, both dates inclusive, all that area of
the Atlantic Ocean within the three-nautical mile New York State jurisdictional
limit lying easterly of a line originating at the southeasternmost corner of
the easternmost cabana building at the Silver Gull Beach Club (located at the
foot of Beach 193rd Street, at the western limit of Fort Tilden, in Rockaway

Point, local landmarks) and extending southeasterly to Ambrose Channel Lighted

Whistle Buoy "A" (RW "A" Mo (A) W WHIS RACON "N" -.) (located at the approach
to Ambrose Channel); and all that area of the Atlantic Ocean within the
three-nautical mile New York State jurisdictional limit lying southerly and
westerly of a line extending southwesterly from East Rockaway Inlet Breakwater

Light (Fl W 4s 34ft 4M) (located at the tip of the jetty at the southern
entrance to East Rockaway Inlet) to East Rockaway Inlet Lighted Bell Buoy "ER"
(RW "ER" Mo (A) W BELL 5M), and thence continuing northwesterly to the
southeasternmost corner of the southeasternmost apartment building of Dayton

Towers (located at 7400 Shore Front Parkway, Arverne, local names and local
landmarks), is in such sanitary condition that the shellfish thereon may be
taken for use as food, and such area is designated as certified. 'Note': All reference points in this section, except local
landmarks and local names, are taken from N.O.A.A. Nautical Chart No. 12326, 53rd Ed., January 2016 and U.S.C.G. Light List Volume 1, 2021. Notes

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
